briefTitle: Permanence of Indocyanine Green in Axillary Lymph Nodes 3 Weeks After Subdermal Injection in Patients With Breast Cancer and Metastatic Lymph Nodes
officialTitle: Permanence of Indocyanine Green in Axillary Lymph Nodes 3 Weeks After Subdermal Injection in Patients With Braast Cancer and Metastatic Lymph Nodes (FLUO)
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Permanence of fluorescence at the level of axillary lymph nodes at 2-3 weeks after subcutaneous injection of Indocyanine Green (2.5 mg), in patients who will undergo radical axillary surgery
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Written informed consent must be obtained and documented before starting protocol-specific procedures and follow-up, according to local regulatory requirements.
* \>18 years old
* Breast cancer patients with cyto-histologically ascertained lymph node metastases and candidates for quadrantectomy/mastectomy combined with radical axillary surgery

Exclusion Criteria:

* patients allergic to Iodine or Indocyanine Green
* patients with thyroid diseases (hyperthyroidism, autoimmune thyroid adenomas)
* patients who are not candidates for radical axillary surgery
* pregnant patients
* underage patients
* interdicted patients or patients requiring a support administrator
